poem:
### Ku Lo Sa

In Lagos lanes, summer hits like Ku Lo Sa,
notes that pirouette, a trilling call,
Oxlade's voice, delicate as whispers
that kiss the air – an African lullaby
in pockets of pop. Even delayed,
its echoes – a ripe fruit, ever sweet, 
remind us all that stars emerge
from gentle seeds and patient rain.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Oxlade: OFA (Oxlade from Africa) review – an extremely likable debut Nigerian prospect Oxlade landed a huge viral hit in 2022 with Ku Lo Sa, an addictive summer love song. In taking two years to follow it with his debut album, the 27-year-old singer has probably lost a little momentum, but OFA (Oxlade from Africa) is extremely likable, delicate pop. Stars such as Dave and Popcaan feature, but Oxlade’s imploring vocal, trilling softly in spacious". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Oxlade: OFA (Oxlade from Africa) review – an extremely likable debut Nigerian prospect Oxlade landed a huge viral hit in 2022 with Ku Lo Sa, an addictive summer love song.
